articles.author: Sheila Dang
articles.description: X, the social media company formerly known as Twitter, said Tuesday it would now allow political advertising in the U.S. from candidates and political parties and expand its safety and elections team ahead of the 2024 presidential election.
articles.title: X will allow political ads from candidates, parties ahead of US election

articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: U.S. auto regulator NHTSA asked whether users of Tesla's (TSLA.O) Autopilot software were paying enough attention while driving, after the EV maker changed how it monitors drivers, documents released on Tuesday showed.
articles.title: US regulator asks for information on Tesla Autopilot monitoring drivers

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A U.S. judge has rejected Burger King's bid to dismiss a lawsuit claiming that it cheated hungry customers by making its Whopper sandwich appear larger than it actually is.
articles.title: Burger King must face lawsuit claiming its Whoppers are too small

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. job openings fell for a third straight month in July as the labor market gradually slows, but conditions remain tight, likely ensuring that the Federal Reserve would keep interest rates high for some time.
articles.title: US job openings in July post third straight monthly drop

articles.author: Max Cherney
articles.description: Google unveiled a swath of fresh artificial-intelligence technology and partnerships on Tuesday that were geared toward bringing more of the growing technology to large businesses.
articles.title: Google unveils enterprise AI tools, new AI chip

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Apple (AAPL.O) said on Tuesday it would host its fall event on Sept. 12, setting the stage for what analysts believe will be the unveiling of a new line of iPhones and smartwatches.
articles.title: Apple to host fall event on Sept 12, analysts expect new iPhones

articles.author: Jody Godoy
articles.description: A Manhattan federal judge dismissed a lawsuit against Unilever Plc (ULVR.L) on Tuesday that claimed the company misled U.S. investors by not immediately disclosing a decision by its Ben & Jerry's unit to stop selling ice cream in Israeli-occupied Palestinian territories.
articles.title: Unilever beats shareholder case over Ben & Jerry's Israel boycott

articles.author: Patrick Wingrove
articles.description: The Biden administration on Tuesday released its list of 10 prescription medicines that will be subject to the first-ever price negotiations by the U.S. Medicare health program that covers 66 million people, with big-selling blood thinner Eliquis from Bristol Myers Squibb (BMY.N) and Pfizer (PFE.N) among them.
articles.title: US names first 10 drugs for Medicare price negotiation

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has no plans to attend the funeral of Wagner mercenary group leader Yevgeny Prigozhin, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia's Putin won't attend Prigozhin funeral - Kremlin

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: California moved closer to becoming the first U.S. state to ban caste discrimination after a bill to outlaw the practise passed the California Assembly late on Monday.
articles.title: California moves closer to historic caste discrimination ban
